author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> Here is a document explaining the goals/assumptions and significant design decisions that the trusted setup is based on: https://hackmd.io/@6iQDuIePQjyYBqDChYw_jg/SJ-08AoT5

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> From this, I don't think we can allow people with 2G connections to participate (See serialisation section), since it would take them too much time to download the json file. I computed it at around 10-20 minutes with a 8-16Kilobytes per second speed, a binary file brings it down to 3-6 minutes but this is still pretty high  imo

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> As mentioned before, one problem with allowing people too long to contribute, is that it could turn into a non-trivial dos vector

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> I have added a python reference implementation here: https://github.com/crate-crypto/ceremony-specs

It does not match with the specs in two places:

- The coordinator does not send update proofs to contributors. This was removed so that the file that contributors receive does not grow linearly with the amount of contributors.
- Added subgroup checks. Currently the specs are doing group checks but not subgroup checks
